narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I would describe this course as a survey course in U.S. history explored via the U.S. military. I learned about the strategy and tactics of the U.S. Navy, Marine Corps, and, to a lesser extent, the Army and Air Force. The class also provided ample time for class discussion and debate in a small (~10 students) setting, which was a refreshing change from my other classes.

I had never taken a course focused specifically on Naval History so the class coverd topics that I had limited exposure to in the past. It also covered familiar historical topics but focused on new details, specifically the role of the Navy in such events and how the US Navy itself developed throughout our history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Professor (CAPT Withrow) was very invested in class--he posted lecture recordings and class notes promptly, and was quick to communicate updates to the class. The material itself was interesting--being an in-depth review of naval tactics and strategy over time--but CAPT Withrow always added "sea stories" to spice up the material, too. CAPT Withrow also provided thorough and prompt feedback to essays.

Strengths: Invested and passionate professor with many experiences and insights into the modern Navy. 
Weaknesses: Limited depth due to the many years of history covered.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
